docs.lead_paragraph: New York state health officials have stopped a nonprofit group from providing free medical care to thousands of patients lacking health insurance during a four-day dental conference that starts Friday.

headline.main: New York State Blocks Free Medical Services at Event
headline.print_headline: New York State Blocks Free Medical Services at Event

docs.snippet: New York state health officials have stopped a nonprofit group from providing free medical care to thousands of patients lacking health insurance during a four-day dental conference that starts Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: If Christian Avila lived a few hundred miles to the west, he would have a driver's license and qualify for in-state college tuition and a host of other opportunities available to young people granted legal status by President Barack Obama two years ago.

docs.lead_paragraph: Like Obamacare, Republicans went on the attack over the E.P.A.’s proposed regulations to curb emissions of ozone. And we know why.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column dismisses complaints from Republicans about proposed Environmental Protection Agency rules designed to curb emissions of ozone; examines why polluters can always count on Republican support to continue polluting; posits that rising inequality is in part responsible for partisan divide on environmentalism.
docs.snippet: Like Obamacare, Republicans went on the attack over the E.P.A.’s proposed regulations to curb emissions of ozone. And we know why.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors and an insurance association discuss an Op-Ed essay that said financial forces corrupt medicine and undermine trust in doctors.
docs.snippet: Doctors and an insurance association discuss an Op-Ed essay that said financial forces corrupt medicine and undermine trust in doctors.

docs.lead_paragraph: “Remote Area Medical” chronicles a nonprofit group that stages free clinics in areas that lack access to basic health care.

headline.seo: ‘Remote Area Medical,’ a Health Care Documentary
headline.main: A Doctor Will See You Now
headline.print_headline: A Doctor Will See You Now

docs.abstract: Neil Genzlinger reviews documentary film Remote Area Medical, directed by Jeff Reichert and Farihah Zaman.
docs.snippet: “Remote Area Medical” chronicles a nonprofit group that stages free clinics in areas that lack access to basic health care.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Five of the 20 physicians who received the most money from Insys, maker of Subsys, a powerful painkiller, recently faced legal or disciplinary action.

headline.main: Using Doctors With Troubled Pasts to Market a Painkiller
headline.print_headline: Drug Company Enlists Doctors Under Scrutiny

docs.abstract: Analysis of federal Open Payments database shows that five of the 20 physicians who received most money from Insys, maker of powerful and addictive painkiller Subsys, recently faced legal or disciplinary action; data gives insight into lengths that some drug firms go to nurture relationships with doctors, and shows that Insys engaged doctors with troubled pasts to market its products to other doctors.
docs.snippet: Five of the 20 physicians who received the most money from Insys, maker of Subsys, a powerful painkiller, recently faced legal or disciplinary action.

byline.contributor: Agustin Armendariz and Susan Beachy contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many immigrants in the United States illegally who apply for work permits under President Barack Obama's new executive actions would be eligible for Social Security and Medicare benefits upon reaching retirement age, according to the White House.

headline.main: Some in US Illegally Could Get Retirement Benefits
headline.print_headline: Some in US Illegally Could Get Retirement Benefits

docs.snippet: Many immigrants in the United States illegally who apply for work permits under President Barack Obama's new executive actions would be eligible for Social Security and Medicare benefits upon reaching retirement age, according to the White House.

docs.lead_paragraph: If it wins federal and state legislative approval, Wyoming will join 27 states that have added program coverage under the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Wyoming Devises Plan to Expand Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Wyoming Devises Plan to Expand Medicaid

docs.abstract: Wisconsin Gov Matt Mead leads his state into joining 27 other states that have expanded Medicaid under Affordable Care Act; administration's plan will provide Medicaid coverage to an additional 18,000 low-income people if it wins both federal and state legislative approval.
docs.snippet: If it wins federal and state legislative approval, Wyoming will join 27 states that have added program coverage under the Affordable Care Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: The applications at the start of the three-month enrollment period showed that in contrast to initial problems last year, HealthCare.gov was working.

headline.main: In First Week, More Than a Million Apply for Health Insurance on Federal Website
headline.print_headline: In First Week, More Than a Million Apply for Health Insurance on Federal Website

docs.abstract: Obama administration officials report that more than one million people submitted applications for health insurance in first week of open enrollment under Affordable Care Act, proving federal marketplace HealthCare.gov is working.
docs.snippet: The applications at the start of the three-month enrollment period showed that in contrast to initial problems last year, HealthCare.gov was working.
